story.title: The Puppeteer - Episode 5
story.storyDescription: When Catherine discovers a creepy old puppet in her room, everything she thought she knew about her life starts to unravel.
story.creator: web-uploader

messages.text: Catherineâ€™s mother and aunt quickly descend on Catherineâ€™s frozen body.
Agnes pries the puppet out of her clenched fist.
They hoist Catherine up off the ground and begin carrying her back to the house.
Iâ€™ve had enough. Letâ€™s destroy the puppet once and for all.
But how will we finish him off? Do you have any idea?
I have something in mindâ€¦but Iâ€™ll need to look through the old spellbooks to find it.
They carry Catherine into the study and sit her down on the sofa.
Agnes throws the puppet on the floor and begins to search the bookshelves.
Catherineâ€™s mother turns towards Catherine, her expression soft.
Catherine, honey, I know you must be confused right now.
But you have to understand that what Iâ€™m about to do is for your own good.
The perception you have of your father is wrong.
He tried to hurt usâ€¦to hurt our family.
Catherineâ€™s motherâ€™s expression hardens. The color in her cheeks rises.
You see, Catherine. You, Agnes, and I are part of a long line of witches.
Our ancestors were smart, cunning women who developed our witchcraft to harness power in a time when power was not readily available to them.
Our line has existed for centuries. Many of us have occupied great, noble positions throughout history.
Weâ€™ve helped so many women who havenâ€™t been able to get their voices heard. Whoâ€™ve been neglected.
Catherine, honey, thatâ€™s why we must do whatever it takes to achieve success.
We eliminate anyone who stands in our way.
Catherineâ€™s mother reaches out a bony hand and grasps Catherineâ€™s arm tightly.
We are COMPLETELY self-reliant, with one exceptionâ€¦
We still require men to have children.
And often, itâ€™s simply more effective to take them in as our husbands to bear the RIGHT kind of daughter.
But once we have our daughters, we do what we must to rid ourselves of the men.
Most men walk away willingly. We tempt them with some younger, vapid woman.
Your father, however, refused to go.
Catherineâ€™s chest tightens at the mention of her father. She dreads what her mother will say next.
When I began to push him away, he questioned my motives and eventually began to dig into my family history.
He confronted me about it one time, claiming that Agnes and I were corrupt and cruel.
But he understood so little, that stupid man, and he mistook our determination for cruelty.
When he tried to turn you against me and said that he wouldnâ€™t let me teach you witchcraft, I knew I had to get rid of him.
As Catherineâ€™s mother divulges their crooked family history, Agnes continues to search the bookshelves.
He had to be stopped, Catherine honey, so I created a curse that trapped his soul in a puppet.
I thought it was quite symbolic -- my final reminder that I, not he, am in control of this family.
It worked like a charm.
Sure, you moped around for a while, but eventually you became yourself again.
It was peaceful here for many years. Until today, that isâ€¦
Aunt Agnes pulls out a small book with faded brown leather binding. Its yellow pages have wilted with age.
Found it!
Good. Letâ€™s have a look.
Catherineâ€™s mother and aunt begin flipping through the bookâ€™s pages.
Suddenly, the puppet lets out a sound.
I thought you said it couldnâ€™t speak!
It seems to be gaining power the longer we wait.
Carâ€¦ [mumbling]
What is he saying?
I donâ€™t know. Hurry!
Car-lyle.
Carlyle.
Who is Carlyle?
Catherine instantly knows what her father means.
Because years ago, Catherineâ€™s father had taken her to Lake Carlyle on her 10th birthday.
Itâ€™d been the best day. After they swam in the lake for hoursâ€¦
He made her promise that sheâ€™d always remain true to herself.
Sheâ€™d always thought it was a strange kind of promise, but now she understood her fatherâ€™s intention.
How am I supposed to know who Carlyle is?!
Hurry, Agnes! We canâ€™t let him talk.
Iâ€™m going as fast as I can, Marie. Would you just stay calm?!
Catherine applies her auntâ€™s advice to her own situation, and carefully looks around the room.
Her motherâ€™s book on the coffee table, and itâ€™s still open to the page with the freezing curse. Down, at the bottom of the page...
Its counter-curse is written in faded ink.
Catherine tries to read the words. Once sheâ€™s got them, she recites the counter-curse in her headâ€¦
And her muscles begin to loosen.
Here it is â€“ this curse should finish him off.
Good.
I should have just done this in the first place.
Iâ€™ll read the incantation.
[Mumbling]
Catherineâ€™s mother stops reading.
Catherine?
Catherine continues to mumble the counter-curse. Her muscles rapidly relax and her jaw slackens.
Catherine, what are you--
Catherine jumps up from the sofa.
Her mother looks shocked, but then her expression slowly curls into a sly smile.
You cast your first spell.
See how it feels to use your magic, dear? To feel powerful?
Think of all of the things you could do.
Shut up!
Catherineâ€™s motherâ€™s eyes widen with rage.
Donâ€™t you dare talk to me like--
You killed dad! You MURDERED him.
I was protecting you! Protecting US!
You werenâ€™t protecting anyone.
Youâ€™ve become disillusioned with power. Youâ€™re using your magic for evil.
Cut the dramatics, Catherine.
You have no idea what youâ€™re talking about.
Yes, I do. Dad saw what you were doing and tried to stop it.
So you KILLED him for it?
If this is the life of a witch, then I donâ€™t want to be a part of it.
Honey, Iâ€™m sure youâ€™ll come around after youâ€™ve taken some time to cool off your hot head.
Donâ€™t get your hopes up.
Iâ€™m going to save dad.
And then he and I will stop you for good!
Catherineâ€™s mother glares at her and her voice becomes very quiet and serious.
You chose the wrong side.
She turns quickly towards the puppet and shouts something unintelligible.
The puppet lets out a screech.
Catherineâ€™s mother and Agnes flee the study.
Dad! No!
Catherine runs to the puppet and holds it in her hands.
But as she cradles it, pieces of the puppet begin to flake off and fall to the ground,
Disintegrating into ash as they hit the floor.
She watches her father decompose slowly, right before her eyes.
They cast the final curseâ€¦
Catherineâ€¦
Dad? You can talk?
Just for a minute.
I failed you, Dad.
No, I was doomed from the start.
Your mother started this process years ago.
Sheâ€™s only accelerated it now.
But I fought on for one reasonâ€¦
What? What good can possibly come of this?
Now I have to come to terms with your death all over again.
And of the fact that Mom killed you.
But Catherine, I got to SAVE you.
Youâ€™re not evil.
You chose the right side.
And now I can die knowing youâ€™ll be safe.
Remember the Carlyle, sweetheart.
Remember it alwaysâ€¦
The puppetâ€™s limbs continue to flake away. Its face loses its form, like a candle melting under a flame.
Tears well up in Catherineâ€™s eyes, but she blinks them back and straightens her spine to its full length.
Iâ€™ll stop them, Dad.
They wonâ€™t get away with this.
The final remnants of the puppet fall between Catherineâ€™s fingers and disappear in the pile of ash on the ground.
With a pop, there are suddenly only two wet eyeballs left in her hands before they dropâ€¦
And roll across the floor.
